result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L Ressler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles L Ressler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles L Ressler was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Charles L Ressler was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Minutes from 16CT2 5/6/16 Initial Appearance**

Case called at 3:04 pm [sf]
Defendant Charles Lee Ressler in court, in custody. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds that the warrant has been executed and should be withdrawn from any database.
Service of Complaint admitted; DOB confirmed accurate, new address provided; charge/penalties recited; reading waived
Court reviews the procedural posture of the case.
Bond recommendation and argument by parties.
Right to Counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Court reviews right to counsel. Mr. Ressler waives this right; Court finds waiver is made knowingly, voluntarily and accepts the waiver and finds him competent to represent himself.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $284.50 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $484.50 , to be piggy backed onto his current payment plan. Non-payment results in 8 days jail with Huber consecutive. 


3 demerit points assessed
No suspension of driving privileges

3:32 pm Court calls 15CF54 & 16CT26 to address the defendant's payment plan. Court superceeds previous payment plan and orders that the Defendant post $100 by 4:00 pm friday 5/13/16 and then the defendant is to pay $50 per month on the 13th day of the month thereafter. 

Recess: 3:36 pm 

** on 16CT2 off record Court orders defendant To submit a DNA Sample/Booking**

Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result in re-imposition of FTP sentence without further notice of hearing.

Case called at 1:37 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Charles L Ressler in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified-No request to be heard

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #2 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3
On Motion of the State, the Court dismiss Count #1

On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber Release privileges for counseling, employment; to commence 8/7/15 at 6:00 pm 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 +$200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in $50 increments per month beginning 8/14/15 and on the 14th day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

On Count #4, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--pay costs of $243 +$200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in $50 increments per month beginning 8/14/15 and on the 14th day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
Recess: 1:58 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-14-2015 01:30 pm
Scheduling notice

Case called at 8:32am [mo]
[Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing]
Defendant Charles L Ressler in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ updates the Court as to the current status of the case; Atty. Zarwell agrees to this status
recess: 8:33am--reconvene:8:35am (to allow Mr. Ressler and Atty. Zarwell to complete waiver of prelim paperwork)

Mr.Ressler waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Court and Counsel agree to combine the Arraignment with the Plea and Sentencing, if needed. 

recess: 8:38am--reconvene: 8:40am
Atty. Zarwell notifies the Court that Mr. Ressler has an AODA assessment scheduled for later in the of the scheduled Plea and Sentencing date and requests a new date and time.
No objection from DA Happ

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.

After consulting the the Judicial Assistant for available dates and times, Atty. Zarwell and Mr. Ressler decide to keep the scheduled Plea and Sentencing date with the anticipation that Defense will ask for a later jail report date.
recess: 8:45am

NEXT:  Plea and Sentencing: July 14, 2015 at 1:30pm
Preliminary hearing at 06-29-2015 08:30 am
Scheduling Notice

[MK] cases #15CF54 and #15CF55 called at 2:09pm. 
Co-Defendant Charles L Ressler appears via videoconferening from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody,  with Attorney David Zarwell.   
Co-Defendant Jessica Ressler appears in court with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. 
ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin, in court.

As to case #15CF54:  On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
recess 2:14pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial on 5/6/15 at 2:00pm (15CF54) and at 9:00am (15CF55),   (2)  Status Conference on 6/2/15 at 10:00am.
NOH for Def. sent to LKA
Adjourned initial appearance on April 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Co-Defendants' cases #15CF54 and #15CF55 called at 2:09pm. 
Co-Defendant Charles L Ressler appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. His counsel, Attorney David Zarwell appears in court. 
Co-Defendant Jessica L. Ressler appears in court. 
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Case #15CF54: on agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
As to Case #15CF55:  right to counsel given. Ms. Ressler indicates that she has submitted PD eligibility paperwork and was told that counsel is being appointed for her. She was expecting counsel to appear with her today. 

As to both Co-Defendants:
Each Co-Defendant verifies that their date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct.   
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 

As to Case #15CF54: Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
As to both cases, the Court adjourns the Initial Apperance. 

As to each Co-Defendant, the Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with the Co-Defendant 
--no possession of hypodermic needles or syringes without a documented medical need
--no contact with Larry Klatt 
--booking at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today 
recess 2:20pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on both cases on 4/14/15 at 2:00pm.
Attorney David Zarwell
